oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Controversy Surrounding the Role of the Bovine Virus Diarrhea Virus (B.V.D.V.) in the Pathogenesis of Pneumonic Pasteurellosis in Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Radostits, Otto M.
Townsend, Hugh G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine virus diarrhea virus
BVDV
shipping-fever complex
pathogenesis
pneumonic pasteurellosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a brief review and discussion of the evidence which has proposed for about the last 20 years that the bovine virus diarrhea virus (BVDV) has a role in the pathogenesis of pneumonic pasteurellosis of cattle which is one of the most common causes of acute undifferentiated bovine respiratory disease or the "shipping-fever complex." We propose to show that there is no substantive evidence to implicate the BVDV in the pathogenesis of acute respiratory disease in cattle.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1988; 111-114
